definition[0]: profit that is made when an asset is sold for more than it cost, or more than its BOOK VALUE
example[0]: Much of its profit increase came from the sale of an office building for a capital gain of FF1.3 billion.
example[1]: The group realized a capital gain of SKr100 million on the sale of its laundry and textile units.
example[2]: You may incur a capital gain (=make a capital gain that will be taxed) every time you transfer money from one mutual fund to another.
